title: Green Pellets India to Showcase Sustainable Fuel Innovations at Bioenergy Global Expo 2025
summary: Green Pellets India will exhibit eco‑friendly biomass pellet solutions and engage industry leaders at the Bioenergy Global Expo in Delhi.

title: Centre Revises Biomass Guidelines to Boost Bio‑Energy Adoption
summary: The Central government has simplified the MNRE Biomass Programme guidelines, easing paperwork and documentation for MSMEs to accelerate biomass adoption across India.

title: India’s 5% Biomass Mandate Demands 1 Lakh Tonnes but Supply Is Only 7,000 Tonnes
summary: Despite the policy requiring 5% biomass co‑firing in coal plants, India currently only supplies around 7,000 t/day — widening the supply-demand gap.

title: Global Pellet Market to Hit USD 12.3B in 2025, with Asia Leading Growth
summary: The global biomass pellets market is projected to grow from USD 12.3 billion in 2025 to USD 23.6 billion by 2035 at a CAGR of 6.7%, with Asia as a major driver.

title: India’s Pellet Production Capacity Still at 7,000 t/day vs Daily Need of 96,000 t
summary: With 217 manufacturing units and ~7,000 t/day capacity, India needs to scale massively to meet its 96,000 TPD blending requirement.

title: India Biomass Market to Reach 11.58 GW by 2025, Growing at 5.27% CAGR Until 2030
summary: The Indian biomass power generation market is expected to grow from 11.58 GW in 2025 to nearly 15 GW by 2030.

title: Pharma Manufacturer Replaces Coal with Biomass Fuel in Boilers
summary: Piramal Pharma Ltd has converted its boiler system from coal to biomass, reducing carbon output and fossil fuel reliance.

title: Textile Factories Use Biomass Boilers to Cut Emissions and Costs
summary: Major textile manufacturers in India are shifting from coal to biomass boilers, reducing annual emissions and cutting energy costs.

title: India Sets First Benchmark Price of ₹2.27 per 1,000 kcal for Biomass Pellets
summary: Power ministry has announced a benchmark rate to regulate co‑fired biomass pellet pricing and quality standards across northern India.
